section.title: Description
section.p: Create a temporary file (a file which will be deleted automatically), using a name generated by tmpnam. The temporary file is opened with the mode "wb+", permitting you to read and write anywhere in it as a binary file (without any data transformations the host system may perform for text files).
The alternate function _tmpfile_r is a reentrant version. The argument reent is a pointer to a reentrancy structure.

section.title: Returns
section.p: tmpfile normally returns a pointer to the temporary file. If no temporary file could be created, the result is NULL, and errno records the reason for failure.
